corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

sentence.text: Marie-Claire and Monique learned little English because Frederica intimidated them and they intimidated her .
We sat stuffing ourselves with smoked-salmon sandwiches , slurping Earl Grey , while she charmed and intimidated them with her stolen airs and purloined graces .
` You ca n't possibly be suggesting Father intimidates her , " Guy said .
` I wo n't agree to a divorce , " he warned , and moved closer , as if trying to intimidate her physically with the powerful bulk of his body .
Maybe because Leila looked on Roirbak as a kind of surrogate father , she did not feel intimidated by him .
He glared directly at Urquhart , trying to intimidate him into total frankness .
The momentary shadow touched but could not intimidate him ; he had gone somewhat beyond fear for himself .
Before , she had slightly intimidated him .
This was n't because he did n't care for a hardship see , or because the malais had intimidated him .
` People in the music business intimidate me , " she says .
They tried to intimidate me by holding on to the furniture .
He did n't use his status to intimidate me .
` You think you can intimidate me , but you 're mistaken !
Their size alone is enough to intimidate any other animal that may threaten them .
Chancellor Kohl can intimidate mavericks in his Christian Democrat party by threatening to move their names down on the electoral list , exposing them to the risk of defeat at the polls .

It was obvious that Rhee had intimidated the national assembly with threats of arrest .
Children have voracious appetites for authenticity , but in drama we should never intimidate them with factual information .
There was a paddle with which Koresh beat his followers and he intimidated them by openly boasting , in crude detail , about even worse brutality .
His blustery manner brought out large crowds despite frequent government attempts to intimidate rural populations into staying away .
Fires are lit once again to subdue and intimidate the elephants .
Haseley Crawford was trying to intimidate everybody , which I later learned was his usual pre-race gambit .

Magistrates are being urged to get tough on landlords who harass and intimidate their tenants .
Cally had been intimidated by the occasion and Jen wanted to give her a boost .
He was also intimidated by Goreng -- especially the previous evening .
The Saudi Arabians , who had been expected to support Venezuela , adopted a low key approach , leading most commentators to suggest that they had been intimidated by Iraq 's belligerence .
The witnesses told the court since going to the police they 've been intimidated by certain people on the estate .
They were arrested after police were tipped off by local residents , who say they 've since been threatened and intimidated .
At least two key witnesses on the case have been systematically intimidated since the killing of Nahaman Carmona , and one is now in exile .

It is clear that male birds with more complicated repertoires can intimidate rivals more successfully and/or attract mates more readily .
Use physical attributes to intimidate and seduce others .
Nicknamed the ` House of Fun " , the chamber was fitted with a sound-system and a strobe light , designed to intimidate and disorientate the victim .

The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation ( FBI ) defines terrorism as : `` The unlawful use of force and violence against persons or property to intimidate or coerce a government , the civilian population , or any segment thereof , in furtherance of political or social objectives . ''
